ui.save_and_test_at_spot: Save & test world at this spot
ui.upload_world_tip: If you upload this world, it will show up to all players under the 'World Browser' section of the map list. If it contains abusive or inappropriate content, it may be removed.
ui.user_maps_info:
Welcome to the World Browser!
This is a list of maps uploaded by other players. You can upload your own maps from the Editor. If you find an issue with a map, you can report it with the flag button.
ui.gamemode_tip: You can hover your mouse over a gamemode in the list for more details on it.

tool_overlay.build_tool:
[ T ]:          Change type
[ M ]:    Change material
[ R ]: Rotate horizontally
[ F ]:    Rotate vertically
[ X ]:          Swap modes
[ Shift ]:          Height up
[ Ctrl/Cmd ]: Height down
tool_overlay.paintbrush:
[ R ]:          Next colour
[ F ]:     Previous colour

editor.free_mouse:
Press ESC to free your mouse.
You can click outside this panel
to capture it again.

tip.0: Tip: Slide on your back using [ Shift ] or ( B ). Jump while back-sliding to go into a roll.
tip.1: Tip: You can use the Extinguisher as a mode of propulsion. This is especially effective in low-gravity.
tip.2: Tip: Bouncyballs can displace light bricks like plastic. With enough power, they can displace wood too.
tip.3: Tip: Use the Extinguisher and a back slide [ Shift ] or ( B ) to slide on your back indefinitely. Try it at a racetrack.
tip.4: Tip: Using lifters, the Extinguisher, a dive, and a roll together, you can soar quite far through the air.
tip.5: Tip: The Flamethrower is prone to blowing up when it's hit by something.
tip.6: Tip: When you are in a vehicle, the Extinguisher can be used as a boost.
tip.7: Tip: Jumping while in a dive will send you into a roll if you are going fast enough.
tip.8: Tip: The guided Missiles are good for long-range. But be careful, they leave your character out in the open whilst you're controlling the missile.
tip.9: Tip: You can control your rolls and slides by aiming the camera in the direction you want to go.
tip.10: Tip: When underwater, aim the camera in the direction you want to swim; press [ Shift ] or ( B ) to dash.
tip.11: Tip: You can jump to cancel a slide or roll.
tip.12: Tip: Plastic is light and non-flammable. However, it falls apart very easily when hit by bouncyballs or other bricks.
tip.13: Tip: Metal is non-flammable but very heavy. This makes it bad for building vehicles, but very good for destroying vehicles.
tip.14: Tip: Larger bricks are better at destroying other objects.
tip.15: Tip: Building a long bar out of 1x1 bricks will make it bendier than if it were made out of one long brick.
tip.16: Tip: With sustained fire, the Pulse Cannon will blow up any explosives that are in its beam, and ignite other players.

property_tooltips.immovable:
Whether or not this brick can be displaced by explosions or other external effects.
Immovable bricks cannot be used for vehicles.
property_tooltips.joinable:
Whether or not this brick can join to other bricks to form a group.
Bricks that are joinable will attach to vehicles.
property_tooltips.indestructible:
Prevents bricks that are in a group from being seperated.
Can be used to make vehicles that cannot be destroyed.

tooltips.obj_pickup: Allows players to pick up tools and weapons.
tooltips.obj_lifter: Pushes players upwards into the air.
tooltips.obj_spawnpoint:
Provides a spawnpoint for a given team that will be chosen at random.
With the 'checkpoint' flag enabled, any player that steps on this (regardless of team)
will have their only spawnpoint set to this one.
tooltips.obj_camera_preview_point: A preview point for the camera. This is used during intro sequences in gamemodes.
tooltips.obj_track_turn: Racetrack piece with a flat turn.
tooltips.obj_track_turn_banked: Racetrack piece with a banked turn.
tooltips.obj_track_divided_transition: Transition piece for divided track (use with Div).
tooltips.obj_track_divided: A racetrack piece divided into two (use with Into Div).
tooltips.obj_capture_point: A capture point that can be used in King of the Hill and CTF.
tooltips.brick: Regular brick with no special features.
tooltips.brick_cylinder:
Regular motor.
Will spin freely around where the motor (grey circle) is attached;
anything attached to the other side will be anchored to the motor and follow its rotation.
When making vehicles, attach the motor side to the body of the vehicle (think of
the motor like an axle.)
You can use Flip Motor Side in the property editor to change the attachment side.
tooltips.brick_motor_seat: Controls any motors that are attached to this brick group when a player sits down in it.
tooltips.brick_lamp: Lamp that provides light. Will shut off if displaced.
tooltips.brick_wedge: Wedge-shaped brick allowing for slopes. Can be dragged out to have different incline degrees.
tooltips.brick_explosive: Explodes when a button attached to it is pressed or it is hit by a bomb, rocket, etc.
tooltips.brick_activator:
Activates (releases) the brick group it is attached to, making it susceptible to gravity.
Also allows vehicles to auto-drive with set steering and acceleration, or to follow the nearest player.
This can be used in many ways, from making autonomous vehicles to ferris wheels and moving platforms.
